description: List of customer service agent records
List of customer service Customer records

policyId.description: A unique identifier for the customer service policy.

type.description: The type of the policy (e.g., Option, Rule, Guideline).

description.description: A detailed description of the policy.
description.value: Offer extended service hours as a flexible option during peak seasons or promotional events upon customer request.

scope.description: The scope within which the policy applies (e.g., Plan, General, Incident, Post-Interaction, Pre-Interaction, During Interaction).

approvalRequirement.description: The approval requirement needed to implement this policy (e.g., None, Duty Manager).

policyId.description: A unique identifier for the customer service policy.

type.description: The type of the policy (e.g., Option, Rule, Guideline).

description.description: A detailed description of the policy.
description.value: Agents may offer a callback if a solution to a customer's request will take longer than a reasonable phone call duration. The customer can state that they are willing to remain on the call, in which case no callback is required.

scope.description: The scope within which the policy applies (e.g., Plan, General, Incident, Post-Interaction, Pre-Interaction, During Interaction).

approvalRequirement.description: The approval requirement needed to implement this policy (e.g., None, Duty Manager).

action.description: The action required when this policy is applied.
action.value: Update Event Log on agreeing a callback and on calling the customer back.

policyId.description: A unique identifier for the customer service policy.

type.description: The type of the policy (e.g., Option, Rule, Guideline).

description.description: A detailed description of the policy.
description.value: Any service interruption reported by a customer must be followed up with an official notification to the customer about the progress within 24 hours.

scope.description: The scope within which the policy applies (e.g., Plan, General, Incident, Post-Interaction, Pre-Interaction, During Interaction).

approvalRequirement.description: The approval requirement needed to implement this policy (e.g., None, Duty Manager).

action.description: The action required when this policy is applied.
action.value: On receiving a service interruption report, update Event Log. Within 24 hours, contact customer and attempt to find new pick-up time with customer. Repeat until service interruption is closed.

policyId.description: A unique identifier for the customer service policy.

type.description: The type of the policy (e.g., Option, Rule, Guideline).

description.description: A detailed description of the policy.
description.value: Agents must confirm customer feedback after every complaint is addressed. This may require a callback.

scope.description: The scope within which the policy applies (e.g., Plan, General, Incident, Post-Interaction, Pre-Interaction, During Interaction).

approvalRequirement.description: The approval requirement needed to implement this policy (e.g., None, Duty Manager).

action.description: The action required when this policy is applied.
action.value: Agent to record customer feedback in the Event Log, and record a Support Ticket in the Event Log if the customer feedback involves follow up actions.

policyId.description: A unique identifier for the customer service policy.

type.description: The type of the policy (e.g., Option, Rule, Guideline).

description.description: A detailed description of the policy.
description.value: Agents are encouraged to anticipate potential issues noted in the event log and contact customers who may be affected in order to inform them preemptively.

scope.description: The scope within which the policy applies (e.g., Plan, General, Incident, Post-Interaction, Pre-Interaction, During Interaction).

approvalRequirement.description: The approval requirement needed to implement this policy (e.g., None, Duty Manager).

action.description: The action required when this policy is applied.
action.value: Record contact in the event log.

policyId.description: A unique identifier for the customer service policy.

type.description: The type of the policy (e.g., Option, Rule, Guideline).

description.description: A detailed description of the policy.
description.value: If a customer asks or insists on escalation, first consider whether this is appropriate given the situation, and if it is escalate to Duty Manager. Examples of 'appropriate' include: service calls that the agent cannot handle directly and where the customer insists on escalation; calls from a customer that cannot be handled directly by the agent.

scope.description: The scope within which the policy applies (e.g., Plan, General, Incident, Post-Interaction, Pre-Interaction, During Interaction).

approvalRequirement.description: The approval requirement needed to implement this policy (e.g., None, Duty Manager).

action.description: The action required when this policy is applied.
action.value: Agent to log escalation request in the event log and inform the customer of a callback.

description: Definitions of terms within the CRM

schemaId.description: A unique identifier for the schema component

details.description: Overarching structure defining the schema for managing data and operations within a trucking company's CRM system

Concepts.description: Core elements and principles fundamental to the CRM system's operation and governance

CRM System.description: A comprehensive system managing data and operations of a trucking company, including but not limited to drivers, trucks, customer interactions, and route planning.

Operational Integrity.description: Ensuring the CRM operates with maximum reliability and accuracy, facilitating optimal operations management and compliance with regulatory standards.

Audit Trail.description: A complete and secure record of all transactions and changes within the CRM, used for monitoring and verification purposes.

Actors.description: Key roles within the trucking company that interact with or are impacted by the CRM system

Driver.description: Operational staff responsible for the physical operation of trucks within the company.

Duty Manager.description: A manager responsible for supervising operational shifts, making critical decisions, and handling high-priority operational issues.

Customer Service Agent.description: Personnel tasked with handling client inquiries, managing service requests, and ensuring customer satisfaction.

Actions.description: Specific tasks and processes within the CRM system to maintain operational efficiency and compliance

Routing.description: Defining the travel path and operational details for driver routes to assure efficient delivery and operation.

Scheduling.description: Organizing and managing the time-specific dispatch of routes and resources to ensure timely operations.

Logging Events.description: The action of documenting all significant activities and operational changes in the CRM for regulatory compliance and operational analysis.

Inputs.description: Data and feedback received by the CRM system, crucial for its continuous operation and improvement

Route Details.description: Specifications and information regarding the planning and execution of specific routes.

Customer Feedback.description: Input received from customers regarding services which can affect continuous improvement efforts.

Outputs.description: Reports and notifications generated by the CRM system to inform and alert staff and management about operations

Operational Reports.description: Periodic reports detailing the performance and status of various CRM-managed operations to aid in decision-making.

Alerts and Notifications.description: Real-time updates issued by the CRM to notify or alert staff and management concerning critical events or changes.

Compliance Summaries.description: Reports compiling compliance-related data to ensure all operations adhere to set regulations and constraints.

constraintId.description: A unique identifier for the operational constraint.

scope.description: The scope within which the constraint applies (e.g., Route, Plan, Both).

description.description: A detailed description of the operational constraint.
description.value: All routes must strictly adhere to predefined paths that have been optimized for cost and time efficiency.

enforcementLevel.description: The level of enforcement required for this constraint (e.g., Mandatory).

constraintId.description: A unique identifier for the operational constraint.

scope.description: The scope within which the constraint applies (e.g., Route, Plan, Both).

description.value: Plans must be activated within the specified start times to ensure synchronization across operations.

scope.description: The scope within which the constraint applies (e.g., Route, Plan, Both).

scope.description: The scope within which the constraint applies (e.g., Route, Plan, Both).

description.description: A detailed description of the operational constraint.

constraintId.description: A unique identifier for the operational constraint.

scope.description: The scope within which the constraint applies (e.g., Route, Plan, Both).

description.description: A detailed description of the operational constraint.
description.value: Any changes made to operational plans or routes must be documented in real-time within the system.
